Schedule and Readings

Week Date Topic Readings
Week 1 Tue, Aug 28 Overview
  • Due at 5:00 PM, HW00
Week 1 Thu, Aug 30 Introduction to the shell
  • Due at 11:59 PM, HW01a
  • Ramey, Chapter 1 - "Introduction"
  • Ramey, Chapter 2 - "Definitions"
  • Shotts, Chapter 1 - "What is the shell?"
  • Shotts, Chapter 2 - "Navigation"
  • Shotts, Chapter 3 - "Exploring the system"
  • Shotts, Chapter 4 - "Manipulating files and directories"
  • Shotts, Chapter 12 - "A gentle introduction to vi"
  • Shotts, Chapter 24 - "Writing your first script"
  • Schwartz, Video Lectures covering cal, date, pwd, exit, mkdir, ls, less, rm, cd, ln file, cp, echo, bash navigation, and relative paths
  • Github, Cloning a repository
  • Chacon and Straub, Chapter 1: Getting Started (with git)
  • Chacon and Straub, Chapter 2: Git basics
  • Schwartz, Video lecture: Practice basic shell commands
Week 1 Sat, Sep 01
  • Due at 11:59 PM, HW01b
Week 2 Tue, Sep 04 Bash basics
  • Shotts, Chapter 6 - "Redirection"
  • Schwartz, Lecture notes to accompany video lectures
  • Schwartz, Video Lectures covering standard input, standard output, and standard error streams, as well as redirection
  • Schwartz, Video Lectures covering cat, uniq, wc, grep, head, and tail
  • Shotts, Chapter 7 - "Seeing the world as the shell sees it"
  • Schwartz, Video lectures covering expansions, substitutions, escaping, and quoting
  • Ramey, Section 3.1 - "Shell syntax"
  • Ramey, Section 3.5 - "Shell expansions"
  • Shotts, Chapter 19 - "Regular expressions"
  • Schwartz, Video lectures covering grep regular expressions
  • Schwartz, Video lecture: Determining the most frequent words in a corpus using basic shell commands
